The '''warning beacons of Gondor''' were an alarm system for the realm of [[Gondor]].
==History==
<blockquote>“See
column2: there is the fire on [[Amon Dîn]]
column3: and flame on [[Eilenach]]; and there they go speeding west: [[Nardol]]
column7: and the [[Amon Anwar|Halifirien]] on the borders of [[Rohan]]” — [[Gandalf]] to [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]{{HM|RK}}

column1: <blockquote>“…The Lord of the City had beacons built on the tops of outlying hills along both borders of the great range
column2: and maintained posts on these points where fresh horses were always in readiness to bear his errand-riders to [[Rohan]] in the North
column3: or to [[Belfalas]] in the South.” — [[Gandalf]] to [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]

column1: [[Image:Matěj Čadil - Eilenach.jpg|thumb|left|[[Matěj Čadil]] - ''Eilenach'']]

The beacons were two series of permanently manned stations maintained by the lord of [[Minas Tirith]] for raising the alarm in northern and southern [[Gondor]] respectively.  The stations were on the summits of foothills in the [[White Mountains]] (''[[Ered Nimrais]]''). The stations kept signal fires in readiness and stabled fresh horses for couriers.
The northern posts
column2: listed from nearest to [[Minas Tirith]] to nearest [[Rohan]]

column1: We can only speculate on the positions of the southern posts
column2: but based on the description of following foothills of the [[White Mountains]]
column3: and their spread of 20 to 30 miles
column4: there may have been as many as ten beacons along the southern foothills
column5: following a course west by southwest through [[Lebennin]] and passing through the hills north of [[Dor-en-Ernil]]

column1: In the late [[Second Age]] and early [[Third Age]]
column2: they mainly served to warn south Gondor of a danger for the northern province of [[Calenardhon]]
column4: but after the [[Stewards of Gondor|Steward of Gondor]] [[Cirion]] granted Calenardhon to the [[Éothéod]] they were used mainly to warn the people in [[Anórien]] (the only part of Calenardhon Gondor kept in its realm) of danger.

column1: Calls for aid between Gondor and [[Rohan]] were exchanged by a messenger carrying the [[Red Arrow]] instead.
During the [[War of the Ring]] the beacons were lit when [[Minas Tirith]] came under siege
column2: and as the [[Rohirrim]] rode to Gondor's aid they passed all seven beacons by on their way east.

column1: The tomb of [[Elendil]] was hidden on the summit of Halifirien

'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
:One of the major changes made to the story is that when [[Gandalf]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] ride to [[Minas Tirith]] the beacons are ''not'' lit
column2: since the despairing [[Denethor]] has decided not to ask for help. In the movie there is a beacon just above the city
column3: and to summon the Rohirrim Gandalf asks Pippin to evade the guards and light it. Once he has done so
column4: the film depicts the other beacons being lit one by one until the last is sighted by [[Aragorn]] who is in [[Edoras]]
column5: and it is this (and not the [[Red Arrow]]
column6: which is not mentioned in the film) which finally helps him to persuade [[Théoden]] to muster the Rohirrim to Gondor's aid.

column4: atop mountain peaks instead of foothills.</ref>
